intro: Aster leiophyllus var. lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aster, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern North America. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, daisy-like blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial species that blooms from late summer into early fall. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
